resources.string: For more information on COVID-19 in Singapore, visit the COVID-19 Situation Report website by the Ministry of Health by clicking the button below
Getting yourself vaccinated is the best way to reduce the spread of COVID-19. It is as it will prevent you from hospitalization, severe illness, and even death.
Everyone aged two years and above should properly wear a well-fitting face mask. It is as, the mask with the best fit will provide optimal protection from the virus.
Maintain a safe distance of 1m between yourself and others.
Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. If soap and water are not readily available, use a hand sanitizer.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands. Especially when you have been to public places, after coughing, or sneezing.
Clean high-touch surfaces such as tables, doorknobs, countertops, desks, phones, keyboards, and sinks.
Upon arrival, all travelers are to take a PCR test on their own.
While waiting for the status of the test results, travelers are required to quarantine themself in a hotel.
If the results are negative, travelers are allowed to enter the country. If the results are positive, travelers are not allowed to enter the country.
Travelers are required to show their vaccination certificates.
All travelers are required to fill up an ‘arrival white card’. The Immigration officer will scan this and check the particulars against the passport.
